website_summaries.verdict: For anyone tired of lugging their miter saw into position, this work station ends that problem and provides a handy storage configuration.
pros: This bench extends to 30 inches and is optimized for mounting tools like miter saws
The rotational mount enables users to flip the power tool underneath and out of the way
While very heavy, it can be moved from site to site thanks to a tilt and roll setup
cons: The plastic locking mechanisms that hold the rotating mount under the table are a weak point in this design

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why some folks that bought this claim it was difficult to assemble. Basic mechanical assembly rules will keep you safe, and yield a highly favorable result. Honestly if you can't put this together, with the excellent instructions provided, it may be time to turn in that Man Card, put your hair in a bun, and work as a barista. Seriously though, this thing fit my 12" Hitachi compound miter saw like a glove, operates perfectly, was simple to adjust, I just don't know what else a guy could want at $300. Very happy with this quality tool
customer_reviews.author: William Ruehl

customer_reviews.title: Good, once you fix everything wrong with it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really useful item with huge potential, but near-miss execution makes it frustrating. I'll fix everything I don't like myself and it'll still be worth it for me, but if you're not up to wrangling it into the shape it should have left the factory in, try something else or wait for 2.0...
customer_reviews.author: Ilo O. Kratins

customer_reviews.title: Knowing I don't have to lift the saw again
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I ever bought mounted my miter saw never have to lift it again. Like that you can turn the miter saw over and the other side turns into a nice working table . And when you're done with your job you can roll it back in the garage. way to go Bora someone was thinking when they came up with this one. I throw out a Big Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Peewee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my small shop
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I had built a mitre station for myself, and it was alright, but this thing is dead on level every time, easy to tuck away when not in use, and can be used with a planer when you flip it down. Zero regret on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this POS
customer_reviews.text: After messing with this thing for 3 hours trying to square it...I give up. 20 years of experience with everything from building hot rods, to rebuilding full hvac units. Even with all that and a master mechanic friend, we still couldn't get this thing square. Flimsy metal bends at the softest touch and the rotation table is 1/4 inch off out of the box with no way to square it other than cut it and reweld... nope, not gonna do it. SHAME ON YOU BORA, I'm giving away your other products I own, because selling them would be a gross injustice to any would be buyer.
customer_reviews.author: Dom G

customer_reviews.title: Solid and assembly was a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Well designed and solid. Assembly was straight forward as was getting the surfaces level. Wouldn’t want to be lifting this in and out of a truck but I wasn’t after portability. Wings fold down easily to reduce the footprint. Very satisfied with this so far. Nice to be able to flip the saw over and have another small workbench.
customer_reviews.author: Wood Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stand
customer_reviews.text: I had my reservations about this saw. When it came it seemed a bit daunting to assemble but the directions were very easy to follow. After assembly, I was very surprised at the sturdiness of this stand! Really exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Sean S

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected but PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for my husband. He's constantly using his saw and I hate to see him lugging it around. The work station was bigger than I expected and we put it together in the kitchen then had to figure out how to get it out the back door. His can now wheel it around wherever he needs to use it and the sides unfold at the perfect height to hold the longer boards.
customer_reviews.author: K. La Brosse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: 60+ year old & luggin around a compound miter saw is something I dont want to do. Saw this & gave it a try. Trying to get it squared up was a chore but eventually got it.. Love the ease of handling I have a small shed & this fits perfect in my shed takes hardly any space plus has the table to lay stuff on. Very easy to mount my Dewalt 715 saw and was so easy to rotate & lock. But for me when you stow your saw fold the table wings down it is so easy to handle. I would highly recommend this for anyone. GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great table but needs some adjustments
customer_reviews.text: I love this table. Gives me plenty of room to work when fully expanded. Sides lift up easily and are easy to fold down. My only complaint is that the latch to release the table top and allow it to rotate the saw into the upright position doesn’t release on one side. I have to use a screwdriver to pry it out
customer_reviews.author: vsr

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand.
customer_reviews.text: Strong stand, not that difficult to assembly, my DEWALT DWS780 12-Inch Sliding Compound Miter Saw barely fit on it, and since is a sliding saw, the stand handle needs to be pushed all the way down, otherwise the saw will no swing into position, no a biggy. Planing to install some crown molding.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stand for my new 12” Delta Cruzer saw because I didn’t want another Delta miter saw stand. Overall this is a decent stand for a miter saw but is not as well built as I expected. The whole assembly is impossible to get squared up so I have to push one corner in to engage the table lock mechanism. The extension table risers seem to be off track or just poorly made; not sure which, I got tired and frustrated before calling it quits. There are some great features to this stand and it is much better suited for my Cruzer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good idea that is executed with really cheap parts
customer_reviews.text: This basically works as advertised, but I was very disappointed with the quality. The fold up sides and the risers that come up to support boards are really flimsy and feel cheaply made; not even close to being flat. The main locking mechanism that holds the rotating work surface is made of plastic. The wheels are plastic disks that are wobbly. Its a chore to make the push handle to go up and down. I would have preferred to pay $500 for a well made version.
customer_reviews.author: Pdx

customer_reviews.title: All-in-All a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Shipping carton was completely destroyed in transit. I was concerned about damage or missing items but everything was ok. One leveling foot and one handle release were defective but Customer Service quickly sent replacements. Getting the platform to rotate freely require considerable adjustments and time but I was successful in accomplishing. I did apply some lube to the handle ends to get it to slide freely in the handle mount tubes. All-in-all a great product. So convenient and sure beats manually mounting saw to work table and clamping it down and then removing and putting back in storage every time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: DNS

customer_reviews.title: The ultimate garage tool stand, but.....
customer_reviews.text: The ultimate garage or workshop stand. The drawbacks are: plastic pieces used in some critical latching areas and a design/manufacturing flaw in the mounting bracket bolts. They know this and will send you new improved versions if you ask. It should not arrive that way to see if you notice....
customer_reviews.author: Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Who’s I would of bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived when stated. Simple instructions for assemble. Works really well. I love that now I have a work top when I do not need the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Wawrzonek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the PM 8000 for my Festool Kpex miter saw. I read some reviews that the saw wouldn't fit so after numerous measurements, double, triple, and quadruple checking, I decided to take a chance and bought the PM 8000. My Kpex is an older model, at least 10 years old so it may not have the same measurements as any recent versions of the saw. My saw fit perfectly and the adjustable table extensions were easy enough to adjust so everything went well with the assembly, installation, and setup. I'm very happy that I took the chance and purchased this portable saw stand!
customer_reviews.author: OZ4

customer_reviews.title: very well thought out and has really made my saw station more functional.
customer_reviews.text: this is a well made tool. makes a small foot print and ads a nice table top to work on. took a while to adapt to my Makita slide miter saw, but it is very adaptable. I am excited to have it in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Like New” item
customer_reviews.text: Review isn’t for the product as i didn’t fully unbox it. Upon removing the first pieces I immediately noticed rusted gouges in painted metal, dents scratches and bent pieces. I did purchase a “used: Like New” item, however I’ve made that decision on purchases before and items were always as described. This particular item has been heavily used. Definitely not used: Like New. If I can I’ll return, if not I’ll definitely not gamble on the used: like new items going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Problems
customer_reviews.text: Could have given a 5 star rating or a 3 star rating. Product went together quickly and easily. Problem arose when it came time to mount the wheels. The axels were not aligned properly to the frame. On one side, the pin was mounted inward so the wheel was toed inward so it didn't track properly. The pin on the other side was mounted with the tip facing upward so the wheel drug on the frame. A heavy hammer and a few whacks solved these problems, but a little QC would have been better. So, no 5 star rating for what is a very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: xwxman

customer_reviews.title: Not great at all. thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great idea.... but very poorly executed. Go with the DeWalt stand its 100% better. By the way, I would have given no stars if I could have.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Thought Through
customer_reviews.text: Bulky, too Heavy, Too Much Plastic where there should be Metal, Too Big to make it through a Doorway, Very Poorly Thought Through, Great Concept but that is simply where it ends ... I want my Money Back because it is almost unusable ... Would be Great if you have huge doorways and you are the incredible Hulk but there would still be the Plastic being used where it will obviously not last ... It will be heading for the landfill after about 6 months of job site work ... I am so disappointed ...
customer_reviews.author: Dirk

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Bora because the video made this look like a great in shop chop saw stand. Assembly was problematic with a bent tube that I managed to straighten out. The screws provided are some of the worst hardware I have touched. The height adjustment for the side tables is cumbersome and if the stand was manufactured correctly should be totally unnecessary. Work table height adjustment was OK but not great. Pretty disappointing and this one may go back.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Lundin

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR EVERYDAY USE!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: For an extra 100.00 or so they could upgrade the materials and it would be worth it. Do not tighten the screws on the bottom plates if you do it’ll be out of adjustment. Once assembled make your adjustments. It is adequate and a space saver for the occasional handymen. IT IS NOT for the heavy contractor like I was. It will get destroyed to and from job sites. It’s ok for me now with for occasional use. Plus it took over a month to arrive and the outer box was destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Yohe

customer_reviews.title: the first 3 came out fine but, one of the uprights that support the ...
customer_reviews.text: I currently own 5 of these, the first 3 came out fine but, one of the uprights that support the wood product broke and now you have to jimmy the thing to make it work. I did in fact call Affinity and I believe talked to Lenore who said she would talk to the shop and get back to me......Still waiting! The second order of stands as everyone stated dropped, tumbled and destroyed, however we made it work. Maybe a few more straps around these boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Evon R.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of adjustability
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea what other reviewers Had difficulty in assembling and adjusting the side table heights. If you can’t assemble this you probably shouldn’t be using a saw. Only reason I didn’t give a 5 star is that I wish the retainers that lock the table were metal and not plastic “hooks”. Otherwise this is sweet. Installed a Dewalt 12” chop saw.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Small space solution!
customer_reviews.text: When we downsized, my wood working space got a whole lot smaller. The Portamate is exactly what I needed. Because I researched Portamate reviews on Youtube, I knew exactly what to expect - and I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L Tee Jr

customer_reviews.title: Works but has issues
customer_reviews.text: It's ok was hoping for better the biggest issues are the handle doesn't slide easily to move it out of the way of the slide on the saw the locks for the handle just pull out when you attempt to lock them in the position to move the handle and the outside wing with the adjustable platform doesn't lock correctly so when you place material on it to cut it just falls to it's stored height hopefully I can reach out to the company for replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is the biggest challenge with this item Also the 2 side wings take some adjusting to get the right height on both sides. Overall it serves it purpose and allows me to save some space while also providing portability. Quite expensive, but it is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: D.FISHER

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for novice users to complete setup
customer_reviews.text: Hard to assemble. Have to adjust so many times before its perfectly aligned Should have used metal for the side handles instead of plastic You will know what i mean about the handles Overall adjustments of swing panel and miter saw was not smooth Once everything is complete then u should have not have any more heartache
customer_reviews.author: Davester

customer_reviews.title: First problem: the right wing is defective as the ...
customer_reviews.text: First problem: the right wing is defective as the movable insert on the wing does not move freely up and down....gets stuck midway and has to be jammed closed. The locking mechanism for the handle-i have no idea who designed this but it doesn't work well at all, so much so that i took the locks off and used the handle without them. Now that its put together though, not sending back. I weill use it with the one functional wing and try to get them to send me a replacement for that wing. Advice: build your own miter station if you can!
customer_reviews.author: SK. Palumbo

customer_reviews.title: It only takes up 30 in. And That's Great
customer_reviews.text: I thought long and hard about what I wanted to build for a work bench and saw table and take up as little space as possible and Boro fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Olah

customer_reviews.title: Great for mobile saw use
customer_reviews.text: Its a little more assembly than you would think, and not build as sturdy as you'd want. Other than those 2 small flaws, I love it. I went from 1/2 a wall in my garage to a small footprint and still have the ability to have support like I used to have with the built in table.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved My Back....
customer_reviews.text: As I age it gets more difficult to lift my very heavy compound chop saw. I was this advertised and decided to treat myself. I assembled the unit and mounted the saw on top. Easy to put together and I really like the easy of using the saw now. Great piece of equipment to have. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Cheap thin materials. Had to use sheet metal screws to put it together because if you use the pre punched holes it’s to tight and rubs and jambs on everything. The elevator sides don’t lie flat and are hard to adjust. It’s a great idea and could be nice if some quality parts were used. Better off buying 3 Dewalt junk stands than buying 1 $300 stand.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Frye

customer_reviews.title: Bad Packaging! Too thin and not sturdy enough for shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Very BAD packaging from Bora. The UPS gorillas destroyed the box on the way to my house and the two drivers who brought it to my door just laughed about it and said file a claim because UPS has lots of money and it happens all the time! "really?" Some of the bolts were missing and I had to improvise with my own parts, however, got it together. I do like the product. It is perfect for my needs. Rockler is my favorite wood craft supplier! You may want to talk to Bora to better package their heavier products.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Stepinoff

customer_reviews.title: Great table especially if you have no room for storage
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, if you don’t have much room for storage this is for you. Doesn’t take up much room until you need it then just unfold it. It does take a bit to level the leveling tables but once it’s done your set.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky 246

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but Challenging
customer_reviews.text: The unit is ok with regard to strength, but difficult to assemble. Locks for the mounting deck do not lock well into place, and they pop up unexpectedly causing instability. Also, the detents in the handle locks are cheesy and hard to install.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F. Garry

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand
customer_reviews.text: No damage to the box, the steel tube for the front foot was dented on one side. Several spots the paint was scratched, the factory needs quality control before putting in box! Use largest washers on flip top.
customer_reviews.author: JPP

customer_reviews.title: ... some but in the end u will have the BEST miter saw table on the market today
customer_reviews.text: Putting it together could be a little challenging for some but in the end u will have the BEST miter saw table on the market today! Had to make a small addition of 1/2" blocks between mounting rails and saw. Other than that, piece of cake. I LUV IT.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Closter

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions.
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy stand. Be sure you read the instructions about not tightening the cross member screws before putting on the top mounting plate. It is a bit wide so be absolutely sure it will fit through the doorways that you may be using. The wheels are plastic which doesn't really allow you to move it around easily. I may replace those with hard rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply built
customer_reviews.text: Evertime I flip the tablet top, as I'm flipping the edges catch on the sides, so I have to twist the frame with one hand and flip with the other. The sheet metal frame could have been built with a thicker metal for sturdiness. The plastic locks and side tables are questionable. Hasn't broken yet but it feels like I have to baby it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Run Away!
customer_reviews.text: Do not be fooled by the nice pictures. This is a flimsy stand made of thin sheet metal and it twists and warps when moved. Better off with two pair of saw horses and use the money for a DeWalt or Bosch.
customer_reviews.author: Brayton Holt

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. If you pay close attention to swuaring it up before tightening, it works great
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Wampler

customer_reviews.title: OK it's it's just a fancy table.
customer_reviews.text: Cool idea, I like it, it uld use improvements, not impressed with it but like it enough to keep it. It does what it is suppose to do with some adjustments. I could say I would recommend it with some caviat. If you like it and have a need for this. Yep, buy it.
customer_reviews.author: jjv

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but just okay quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I’m limited on working space. I like the fact I can store my miter saw on it and still have a flat surface to use other tools on. What I don’t like is it the beating of the handles to move up or down. This is even after present the detents in to move it. My other issue is it’s not square. This leaves me with having to push parts of it together to lock the flip table portion in place. Overall I think the concept is great, but could use some work the structure of the product. Especially at the price it’s sold at.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my hubby & he loves this for his saw.
customer_reviews.author: CONNIE

customer_reviews.title: ... to build one of wood but this is the perfect table, beautiful design
customer_reviews.text: I was going to build one of wood but this is the perfect table, beautiful design. well constructed and well planned .
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Bonano

customer_reviews.title: Shop Saver
customer_reviews.text: I have a small shop. Most everything is mobile. This workstation solved a series of problems I have dealt with for years. Well thought out, sturdy and convenient. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Edmiston

customer_reviews.title: Kenneth E Bowen
customer_reviews.text: This item is too weak, it isn’t near accurate enough, I would be a happy If I could get my four hundred plus $ back.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: I really like the stand. I would have given it 5 stars but the weld on one tire was at about 80 degrees instead of 90. Still works but rolling is a key feature of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Boldt

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS THING!!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't have another table for my cut off saw after using this one.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Shaw

customer_reviews.title: You’re gonna love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, this item is sturdy and gorgeous to look at. We mounted a saw to it it hides away beautifully
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: BOAR PORTAMATE
customer_reviews.text: This is great addition to my shop, it is easier than ever to access my miter saw as well as saving space in my work area. makes a necessary tool mobile and creates a solid work station
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea but tabs that lock rotating top not robust. Bolts to short, irregular size.
customer_reviews.text: I think the product will work well enough, bt the plastic tabs that hold the rotating table are plastic and don't lock in well with the lever. I have to push them in. not sure will hold up in the long run. Bolts that came with unit to hold tool are not long enough for my chop saw and couldn't find bolts with same flank size to fit in slot so have to grind them down to work.
customer_reviews.author: Pro Crast

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME
customer_reviews.text: I love it!! I like when not in use I can flip it and use other side as a work table
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works much better now but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: arrived damaged of course. It seem everything I order these days is dropped out of a plane.. Too much pain in ass to return it so I strained it myself. Works much better now but not perfect.. Bit disappointed in the light gauge metal bends too easily. Espically if ups delivers it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Assembly needs to be easier, but very sturdy and storage all in one is great.
customer_reviews.text: Setup is a little difficult. Had to keep readjusting screws to get the table top so it would work. However, after I got that worked out, the product has been great. I love it. Storage and sturdy work space all in one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built well but, it didn't fit my craftsman radial saw.
customer_reviews.text: Built well but, it didn't fit my craftsman radial saw.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I did add a thin board under the saw to eliminate a lot of the sawdust and make cleanup easier. So far, this has been a good addition to my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rozmajzl

customer_reviews.title: very poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could return this for my money back. This is a very poorly made item. The welds are horrible and the fit and finish not very good for a $300 item. The idea is good but this product is not.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for plainer
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my dewalt plainer, I mean really great, the rails pop up to meet Hight of plainer. Strong flip capacity ... this table is strong. Would by again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was easy. Tool gets hung up on bench wings when ...
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy. Tool gets hung up on bench wings when you flip the tool over. Side wings need to be extended up in order to rotate tool for use or storage. Overall construction is solid and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R.

customer_reviews.title: Box arrived I very poor condition. After assembly
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived I very poor condition. After assembly, table did not rotate easily because it is not square. Very disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: mrb

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be great.
customer_reviews.text: If this were better constructed, it would be fantastic. As is, it's good, but leaves a lot to be desired for sturdiness of design and some function, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Casto

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn't be that expensive for what you get.
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt work that well with a sliding saw. The slide sticks out further than the front of the work table area. Somewhat flimsy and finicky to rotate around.
customer_reviews.author: NadiaMarie

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: great this really does the job and it looks great
customer_reviews.author: peter gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: very versatile.  really like the adjustable arm heights.
customer_reviews.text: was able to drill other side to mount dewalt planer
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but poor pieces and instructions.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a neat way to move your saw. However the parts and pieces aren’t easy to assemble. Instructions are not that great and the pieces you will have jimmy up. Didn’t fit like it shows in the photo. Just be cautious.
customer_reviews.author: TIMOTHY RICHARDSON

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great stand for a chop saw and easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for my shop
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy miter saw stand. No room for a dedicated miter bench in my shop, and this fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Pros hold off
customer_reviews.text: This is not for a pro... It might work well for someone who is just cutting 4" base mold but not for any stock that applies weight or pressure to the extensions. Also extensions dont stay parallel to each other
customer_reviews.author: Jay Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Miter Saw Stand
customer_reviews.text: I love the design but the build could be a little more robust. Additional support would have made the building process easier due to the adjustment necessary to rotate the saw/tool.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: but the way it was shipped to me was a disgrace the box was ragged all torn up the table have dents in it one of the legs was bent the right side locking pins is missing and because I got it as a Christmas gift it went past the return date so now what am I supposed to do with it I guess I’ll have to deal with this expensive garbage because now I have no choice so I’m giving ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s a strong and study work table that really works, but the way it was shipped to me was a disgrace the box was ragged all torn up the table have dents in it one of the legs was bent the right side locking pins is missing and because I got it as a Christmas gift it went past the return date so now what am I supposed to do with it I guess I’ll have to deal with this expensive garbage because now I have no choice so I’m giving it one star
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Don’t like
customer_reviews.text: Can not get side tables level don’t go up enough,I am using a Dewalt 12” chop saw
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bird

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged, box was destroyed. It was also ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged, box was destroyed. It was also missing parts. For my needs it was too big and bulky, so I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and easy to handle. Best portable saw carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Marla L. Menard

customer_reviews.title: The perfect multi tool for the garage workshop
customer_reviews.text: The perfect multi tool for the garage workshop! An outfeed table for the table saw, a work station for the project and a miter saw station on wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon's New Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Item was missing four fasteners. Box delivered all torn up.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great equipment bench idea for a small shop as an ...
customer_reviews.text: Great equipment bench idea for a small shop as an "amateur" like me ... I am using two of them !!!
customer_reviews.author: Pierre V.

product_meta.title: Bora Portamate Miter Saw Stand Work Station | Mobile Rolling Table Top Workbench | Orange & Grey with Folding Wing Extensions
product_meta.description: The ultimate Miter saw table/ workstation is here with Bora porta mate's “portable” Miter saw work station. It’s a solid, stable Miter saw bench that lets you securely mount your saw for various projects. But the Real magic happens with the features – two side “wings” fold out and Lock into place, turning your 30” saw table into a 60” or 90” workbench. The wings also have adjustable middle sections, so they Align perfectly with your saw’s height. And when you aren't using the table for cutting, the center portion flips over and locks, giving you a clear, stable work area, All while your saw stays attached, upside down and out of the way. There are also ¾” Dog holes for pegs to help hold your machine in place. Ingenious, right? This work station satisfies every need. If you need a rolling saw table, It’s that. If you need a portable workbench, it’s that. If you sometimes need extensions, but sometimes need compact, it’s that. And if you want a place to keep your saw Forever, yet still use it for other things, it’s that too. Of course, it’s fully portable, with 10” locking wheels and convenient handle. The portable Miter saw work station will become your all-time favorite workbench and be a fixture in your shop or garage for years. Get one today! questions? Please reach out to the manufacturer at info@affinitytool
feature_bullets: Solid saw stability – easily and quickly mount your Miter saw or other power tools on this super secure saw stand work bench. Saw safely with precision, and without any wobbling or movement.

Extendable work space – need a larger work area in your tool shop? Not a problem! The porta cube's two 30” Wings can fold outward and lock into place, providing you with 60” or a full 90" Workspace. The collapsible wings include moveable inserts that align level with your saw.

Convenient mobility – the workstation includes a handle and wheels, allowing it to be easily moved from one area to the next. This rolling stand is perfect to use when space is a consideration or for efficient transportation to different work sites

Saw flips away – when not used for cutting, the saw table area reverse flips, allowing the stand to become a full, level table to be used for planning, measuring and working on other projects. When the saw is flipped down, it stays safely attached and out of the way.

Superb specs – with its strong steel structure, and composite wings, this versatile miter saw stand brings a modern, clean look and superior functionality to any shop. It has peg holes and measures 31”W x 34”h x 29” with heavy duty 10 inch wheels. Our 1-year allows you to buy with confidence.
